title: Spooked
description: Erin is worried that she is about to get fired after she organizes a disastrous office Halloween party for Robert and his son. Meanwhile, Robert probes the minds of the employees to come up with the perfect spooky story.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [looking at Angela's costume] Approved!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [claps] Chef from South Park, it's genius!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Just some chef.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I've decided to pre-screen all the Halloween costumes this year. I have three simple rules - don't be offensive, don't be cliche, and don't take the first two rules too seriously.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: The gorilla from Rise of the Planet of the Apes? Huh? The one who sacrifices his life.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa! Aw, spoiler alert.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It's been out for ages, man.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Costume vetoed.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ah, it's, uh... somebody's already called that.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Who?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Kevin has a gorilla suit you could borrow.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: This is ridiculous! Why can't there just be two Kate Middleton's?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Guys, I know, I mean, I wish there could be, too. It's like, I can't choose. They're both amazing. It's just...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Look, I stayed up all night and I watched that gd wedding, and then I came to work and I made everyone else watch it all day. Meredith wasn't even here.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Because I was there. [shows Kelly her cell phone video] Your the people's princess! Diana was nothing!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I thought you were at your sister's funeral.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What I said was, "My sister's funeral is this weekend." Didn't say I'd be there.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Why is it such a shock that I follow the royal story? Warms my heart, thinking about them two kids, doing it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Um, can I, maybe, squeeze through?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Here you go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: There you go. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: When they talk about all the nice things about dating a coworker, they don't mention one of the best parts. After you're done dating, you still get to work together, every single day.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Jim, put it on.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Put it on, man.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know if I can.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Come on, the Three Amigos.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Three Kings.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know, I know, I know. But Darryl and Kevin needed a third. They bought me this jersey. I said no. Kevin started crying. So, I am Chris Bosh.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [to Kelly] If you get into season 1, you can really...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [Dwight walks in] Oh my god, what the hell is wrong with you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's called a costume.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What are you, some kind of Jamaican zombie woman?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ryan, will you please tell her who I am?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Whoopi Goldberg.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Has no one here heard of Kerrigan, from Starcraft? Queen of blades? It's all Toby's fault.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Every Halloween I tell him the same thing - You can't bring weapons into the office, and every year he says the same thing - As soon as I get my weapons back I'm gonna kill you. But there I am at Thanksgiving, alive, you know. I'm a lucky turkey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Everybody looking good, this is, this is the best we can do? I'm not judging, I, I think you guys look great, I just... wanna make sure this is the best we can do?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I just got a text from Broccoli Rob - "Boo!" Scared me. And then I got this text from Robert California - "Looking forward to Halloween party. Expectations are high." Scared the s**t out of me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: G'day, Pameroo. Could you shoot this off for me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Australian accent...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [faxing, Erin watching over her shoulder] What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, I just wanted to see how you do it, if you're doing something I don't.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. [sends fax, Erin nods] Are you...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: That Andy, so hot and cold. One day he's like, fax these documents, please. The next he's like, Pam, you fax them, who cares what Erin's feeling, right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, Erin...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Pam, how would you rate me as a receptionist on a scale of 1 to 3?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, 2?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: That's like, the second to last thing I wanted to hear.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I mean, you're doing great, and Andy put you in charge of the whole party, right?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Send completed. You are the best in the biz, I can't deny.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Bob and I are doing this Scranton Haunted Walking Tour.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I always wondered what kind of people went on that thing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, hey, if you go by the Banshee Pub, tell the Man In Black I say hello.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [sigh] What happened, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. When I was 22, I worked there and everybody said the place was haunted. I didn't believe it until one day before we opened, I look up into the mirror, you know, behind the bar, and I see this old man dressed all in black, but when I turn around, there's no one there. So, I tell the cook my story...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Wait, they have food there?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: ...and he said, That's what everyone sees, that's the Man In Black.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No! My wife does not believe in ghosts.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, this Man In Black thing, what do you think that was about?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Was it, like, trickery in the lights, or maybe you were so primed to see it, then there it was?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I saw a ghost.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmhmm. No, but what I'm saying is, like, do you ever wonder what it was?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It was a ghost, I told you this on, like, our first date.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I had just told you about the day that I met the Blue Angels. I figured you had to top it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know what to tell you, Jim, but I saw a ghost.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey! Uh-oh, looks like we're under a Jack attack!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Yes, Andrew. And you, on this day of fantasy, are a laborer.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Everyone, this Bert, my son. Bert, this is... a paper company.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [everyone greets Bert]

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: Hello. Can I use a computer? I need to check a hurricane.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Here, use this one. [walking to Jim's desk]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Jim shakes his head "no", Andy motions to him to "shh"]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Oh, look, Pin The Wart On The Wench. How did you know I was bringing my son?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, I didn't. It was for us, but he can play. Bertie-boy, would you like to play this game?

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: That stuff's for babies.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Well, perhaps this party will awaken the baby in all of us.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wow, who shot our grown-up party with a kiddie raygun? We're still getting it set up, it's gonna be really cool.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [laughing] Extraordinary. Did you plan this?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, Toby and I did, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: And I overheard, and thought, hey, that'd be fun, don't mind if I do.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: If you turn out the lights we'll do a little dance.

quotes.speaker: {Gabe}/{Kelly}/{Toby}
quotes.text: [singing and dancing] Dem bones, dem bones, dem tired bones, now we're the skeleton crew.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [laughing and clapping] Delightful.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Thank you. [Gabe mumbles]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Now then, how are we today?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Just fine, Kelly? Everything alright?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: You feeling fulfilled in your life?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I guess.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: You guess? So, there is something you want that you do not have.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I try not to think about it.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Because it's too terrifying to imagine. Now we're cooking. What is it, Kelly? What is this great fear of yours?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Never marrying.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Yes. Dying alone, that is very scary. And how are you, Toby?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: So great.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Angela takes the pumpking decoration off of the window]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, I put those up.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I know. I'm taking them down.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I almost wonder if putting nothing on this wall is more Halloween-y.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't know about this, guys, Andy put me in charge of the Halloween party, so...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, Andy sent us in here, so which is it?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: So, can we speak our minds now, or are we still sparing feelings, because I hate all of this.

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: Very low pressure in the Sargasso Sea, warm air from South America, cold air from Greenland. All signs point to the perfect storm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, perfectly mediocre.

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: What are you, anyway?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm a Jamaican zombie woman, leave me alone, ghoul.

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: If you had some really big wings with blades on the end, you'd kind of look like Kerrigan from Starcraft.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damnit. I AM Kerrigan from Starcraft! I've been censored.

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: If you're going to be a Zerg, at least be a Lurker, not some girl.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Kerrigan is ruler of the Zerg swarm!

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: Yeah, she also has boobs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, but no nipples.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey. What's up?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: November's sure creeping up, ain't it? Can't stop that month!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey, what's the jive with Angela and Phyllis helping with the party, you know?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Um, I just thought you could use some help, you know, because Robert came in and thought the party seemed a little kiddie, and I guess I agreed, and maybe we could mix a little more 13 into the PG.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: But that's it? There's nothing about me, or I?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Can we talk about it at the end of the day? I gotta call, gotta make a call.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, yeah, sorry. Yes, we can.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [pretending to be on the phone] Yes. [laughs] I don't know. Mmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Gabe?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Sweetheart.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm throwing the Halloween Party and I just want to amp it up a little.  I think it could use some extra pizazz.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Ok where does Gabe factor in?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Remember that Halloween party you took me to once?  The one where I started crying as soon as I walked in and I didn't stop crying?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yes.  Lars and Decocco's

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Ok.  Let's say that I wanted this party to be a tiny, tiny bit like that one.  Just... more adult... more...  scary and sexy

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I will make this sexier than you could ever imagine.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No - just scary.  If we wanted ideas for scary stuff.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [laughs, eventually Erin joins him laughing] Oh that would be scary!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What are you thinking?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Ok let me go get it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [answers phone] Pam Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey it's Jim Halpert.  I was wondering if you wanted to see a movie tonight.  Because I've read a lot about this really great documentary.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is it called Ghostbusters?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [laughs] It's called Ghostbusters.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It didn't look like that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It didn't have a buster sign around him?  Why don't you draw him?  Why don't we see this whole thing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok fine I'll draw him. [hangs up phone and draws]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I ain't fraid of no ghost. [Pam holds up drawing of a hand with the middle finger raised] Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmhmm.  Dwight are you eating a stick?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's a root you idiot.

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: Everyone hates you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's really rude.  I don't tell you hurricanes suck even though it's true.

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: What do you like?  Tornadoes?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Try influenza.

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: Oh yeah?  What's the vaccine you can take to avoid a hurricane?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Open up a newspaper.  Oh look a hurricane's coming.  I suppose you're going to tell me the scariest animal is a shark?

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: Try a box jelly fish.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know that's...

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: What are we talking about?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I was talking about my wife and how she believes in ghosts. And then we had a little debate and Meredith said she believes in them too.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [to Kevin] You seem unimpressed.  Ghosts don't scare you?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I'm only scared of real things like serial killers and kidnappers.  Not things that don't exist like ghosts or mummies.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Mummies are real.  There are mummies at museums.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah [nervously]...prank

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: It's true.  They've been preserved for thousands of years.  They're all over.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [screaming] Why on Earth would a museum put a mummy in it?!?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Witch's brew?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I grew this party up real fast.  Get out of here little kid party.  Nobody loves you.  And clean up your room!  Grownups are going to use it later!  Oooh!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Party looks fun doesn't it?  Everybody seems to be in there having a great time.  So maybe now would be a great time for me to pop back on the computer.

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: I'm using it.  I'm about to play Starcraft with him [points to Dwight].

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Dwight] Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah I'm serious.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's funny.  Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Loser.

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Pam do you think anyone's going to notice I've worn this costume before?  When I wasn't pregnant.  You know I bet nobody would believe it still fits.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey guys.  I'm an Oscar [gestures to face] liar [gestures to nametag saying "Representative Weiner] weiner.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh my god!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: This party's tight.  The fog is cool.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thanks.  It's on medium.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It really looks great.  You did a great job.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, so we don't have to have that talk.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We should still have that talk.  Maybe you can come by my office at like 4:45? [Erin nods] Cool.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [in ghostly voice] Oookayyy everybody.  Be prepared to be scared.  Ok. [hits play on DVD player, "Do yes disturb meditations of horror" appears on screen, Gabe winks at Erin, on screen food deflates, a mouse crawls across a photograph of a woman, a person brushes very dirty teeth]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: The cinema of the unsettling is a growing film movement.  The most well known film in the genre is an hour long shot of a squirrel with diarrhea.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [cuts back to a Happy Birthday cake gushing blood when cut into, a doll melts, a woman eats food and puckers her face] Is that my grandmother?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What's the story?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: There is no story.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Yeah it seems like there isn't a narrative. [on screen a man gets into a car]  Maybe the filmmaker realized that even narrative is comforting.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What the hell is going on here?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I think we've seen enough.  You can turn it off now.  [everyone murmurs agreement] Yeah turn it off now.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: How did you get in my car?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Where is this from?  That is so upsetting!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That was awful.  Robert I apologize.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm sorry.  I got confused.  I heard you wanted to make the party more adult.  But I think I know what to do now [grabs box].  This game is called "pecker Poker".  [fighting tears] It's the game of cards that gets you hard.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What we have here is a classic misunderstanding.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Why didn't you simply ask Andy to clarify?  Asking is a very easy thing to do.  You're obviously very close. [Andy and Erin look awkwardly at each other and Robert].  Oh I see.  This no longer seems like my business [Robert sits].

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: All I know is you wanted to have a talk with me and I got nervous so...

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: You were going to talk at the end of the... I'm not here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Did you think I was going to fire you?  No I wasn't.  [to Robert] I'm sorry this must be really uncomfortable for you.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I'm never uncomfortable.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ok.  Erin I think you know I've been dating someone.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And it's getting a little more serious.  She's never come by.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: And she's never called here.  Unless it's your mom.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No I didn't want her to call because I thought it would be weird.  But now it's weird that she's not calling.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Two dates? Three dates?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thirty-one.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Wow.  I'm so happy for you guys.  Um let me know when you get to forty.  I'll see you guys.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I should go.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I just don't get it, Pam. I mean, you're a rational person.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [whispering] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim doesn't let me wash his NFL jersey during the playoffs. How is this any less logical?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Careful, whoa. First of all, it's not like I think that's going to help the Eagles win.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. That is just a bunch of people participating in a collective thing that maybe the Eagles will hear about and want to play better. It's not...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Go, get up there right now.

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: Got it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You wanna attack or let them come to us? Your call, B.

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: Unleash the hellstorm.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [laughs] Nice.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Got 'em. Go!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Is she Asian?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't know. She's from somewhere, I bet. Maybe from the forest.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Forest? Did Andy say his girlfriend's from the forest?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I don't know, Phyllis. Maybe she's from the city.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Looks terribly real, doesn't it, Creed?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: No...

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Are you scared of snakes?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: You don't live as long as I have without a healthy fear of snakes, Bobby.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [in the bathroom with Robert[ Yeah, I guess sometimes I have nightmares about being buried alive.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [talking to Robert] Honestly, Jim gives me the creeps.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [to camera] What am I up to?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Like, a few years down the road, Cece says, "Mom, there's a ghost in my closet." Now, you say one of two things - one, "You're just having a bad dream," or two, "Let's go see what it was."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm not gonna freak her out, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm not gonna lie to her, either.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, come on!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: When I was a boy, there was an empty house just up the hill from my family's. It was rumored a man committed suicide there after being possessed by the devil. One day, a young woman, Lydia, moved into the house with her infant child. That very night, Lydia was awakened by a loud, heinous hissing sound. [hisses] She walked to the nursery, and there, in baby's crib, was a snake wrapped around baby's neck, squeezing tighter and tighter.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Oh my goodness.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: The crib was full of dirt. Baby struggled to free itself from underneath, reaching and clawing, gasping for air. Embalmed bodies rose from their sarcophagi, lurching toward baby, for they were mummies.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nooo!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Amongst them was a man, tall, slim.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Jim. [rolls eyes]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Almost instinctively, she turned to her husband. "Oh, wait," she thought, "I don't have a husband." For Lydia and her husband had had an argument, one they couldn't get past. Each night, they slept one inch farther apart, until one night, Lydia left. It was about this time she lost herself in imaginary worlds. She had quit the book club, the choir, citing something about their high expectations. Her lips slowly grew together from disuse. Everytime she wanted to act and didn't, another part of her face hardened, until it was stone. And that fevered night, she rushed to the nursery, threw open the door, "Baby, are you okay?" Baby sat up slowly, turned to mother and said, "I'm fine, b!tch, I'm fine."

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Fear plays an interesting role in our lives. How dare we let it motivate us. How dare we let it into our decision making, into our livelihoods, into our relationships. It's funny, isn't it, we take a day a year to dress up in costume and celebrate fear.

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: Toby?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh, hey, Bert. Wanna see the dance? Dem bones, dem bones, dem dry...

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: You're fired.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: ...bones. What?

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: You heard me. Pack your things.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: What... you can't... Gabe? Are you...

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: I'm the CEO's son. Pack your things. You're done.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pink is the red-

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: What are we talking about?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I was talking about my wife, and how she believes in ghosts. And then we had a little debate. Meredith said she believes in them too.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Have you seen a ghost?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Seen and banged.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hmph.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Ok, I met him in a bar, right? There's something weird about him. He doesn't smell right, the clothes are all tattered and dirty and from another age. Anyways, we end up back and my place and we go at it all night-

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Meredith, don't.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: No, no. I'm very comfortable with all things sexual. Continue.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I wake up the next morning, all my stuff's gone. Whole house turned over. No trace. You tell me what happened.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Have you considered the possibility that you slept with a drifter?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: He didn't smell like a drifter.

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: What are you anyway?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm a Jamaican zombie woman. Leave me alone, ghoul.

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: I'm a zombie from Walking Dead. It's a show.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, I know what it is. Ok? I have like a thousand people over every week to watch it. Ok? We all kinda hate it though.

quotes.speaker: Bert
quotes.text: Who's your favorite character?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The city of Atlanta.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: If ghosts are real, how come everyone knows what they look like? It's not like a bunch of people got together and agreed on a lie.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Interesting. Every culture holds this true. Clearly, there's some sort of real phenomenon out there...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oscar, how are you on that side?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This isn't about sides. This is about me seeing a blueish gray old man in the mirror and then he vanishes.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Pam, this is important. Was he me? Am I him?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, Creed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But that would make more sense. [Pam sighs]
